title: Chrissie Swan is 'DESPERATE' to host Big Brother 2020
text:
A former Channel 10 executive says that Chrissie Swan is 'desperate' to host the upcoming Big Brother reboot.

Appearing on ABC Brisbane on Monday, Rob McKnight revealed that Chrissie, who shot to fame on Big Brother in 2003, has already 'put her hand up' for the show.

In a surprising twist, he also claims that original Big Brother host Gretel Killeen won't return to front the reboot, despite rumours stating otherwise.

'She is desperate to host it!' Chrissie Swan (pictured) is keen to host the upcoming Big Brother reboot says a TV executive, with Chrissie herself calling the role her 'dream job'

'I was talking to Chrissie Swan who was in Channel 10 series of Big Brother and she is desperate to host it, so she has well and truly put her hand up saying "I would love to do it".'

Referring to Gretel, Rob said that he'd heard that she's 'already out' of the running to host the series, but suggested that Melissa Doyle could have a shot.

'Some talks suggest it might be Melissa Doyle, whose program Sunday Night was axed as part of a cost-cutting measure for Channel Seven,' he said.

'She's already out!' Original Big Brother host Gretel Killeen (pictured) may already be out of the running to host the reality TV reboot

'That program [Sunday Night], some of the budget for that will be used to fund the new series of Big Brother.'

Chrissie has since confirmed that she's keen to host the reboot, calling it her 'dream job' on her Nova radio show on Tuesday.

'Truly, I would love it,'she gushed. 'I’ve always said I would do that.'

'Some talks suggest it might be Melissa Doyle': Former Channel 10 executive Rob McKnight says that Melissa Doyle could host the show following the cancellation of Sunday Night

Chrissie first shot to fame as the runner-up to fan favourite Reggie Bird on the third season of Big Brother in 2003.

She went on to have a huge career in radio and television, and currently hosts her own breakfast radio show, Chrissie, Sam & Browny on Nova FM.

The 45-year-old has also hosted a number of TV shows, including The Great Australian Spelling Bee, Can of Worms, and The Circle.

Flashback: Chrissie (left) first shot to fame as the runner-up to fan favourite Reggie Bird (right) on the third season of Big Brother in 2003

Gretel originally hosted Big Brother on Channel 10 from 2001 to 2007, before Kyle Sandilands and Jackie 'O' Henderson took over for one season in 2008.

The series was then cancelled, until it was revived on Channel Nine in 2012 for three seasons with Sonia Kruger as the host.

The new season of Big Brother is strongly rumoured to air on Channel Seven in 2020.
description: A former Channel 10 executive says that Chrissie Swan is 'desperate' to host the upcoming Big Brother reboot.
